value.title: Power BI Premium Query Profiling with DAX Studio and SQL Profiler
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how you can use DAX Studio, or SQL Profiler, to do query profiling on Power BI Premium. This can help you debug query performance and more.  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Troubleshooting DAX performance? Clear the Power BI model cache!

value.title: Power BI DAX Measures: Understanding Filter Context using SUMX Example (I.C.A.N. Rule) Part 1 of 2

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - DAX Studio Query Performance Tuning - By Marco Russo
value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Marco Russo contributor to DAX Studio will be giving us a deep dive and demo around using DAX Studio for Query Performance Tuning.  You will not want to miss this event as Marco is a wealth of knowledge for all things Data Modeling!  Watch the Full Tutorial

value.title: Creating Calendar Table in Power BI using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: I have previously explained about using Power Query for creating calendar tables, However, some people still love to do that in DAX. There are a couple of DAX functions which makes the process of creating a calendar table very simple and easy; Calendar() and CalendarAuto(). In this short video, I'll

value.title: DAX Measure in the Axis of the Power BI Report
value.excerpt: If you even need to show your DAX measures in a chart without a dimension to slice and dice it, you won‚Äôt get a great experience in the visual. In this video, I‚Äôll share a trick that you can use to have a nice visualization like what you see in the above screenshot. Download the file and study more from

value.title: Day of Year and Day of Quarter   DAX calculations for Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI has some built-in, easy-to-use DAX functions to get the Day of Month and Day of the week, but nothing for Day of Year and Day of the quarter. These calculations, however, are very simple and easy to implement using other functions. This short blog and video explain a method to calculate those
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ulT8HtF4gT0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Dynamic Banding or Grouping in Power BI   Using DAX Measures   Choose the Count of Bins
value.excerpt: Banding (or binning or grouping) is a scenario that can be implemented both statically and dynamically in Power BI. Dynamic banding means selecting the bin (or band) configuration, and the banding changes based on the user selection of the slicer. Imagine that we have a count of customers by their age
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/LaBmDaf_PPM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: In Power BI, there are multiple ways of searching for a text term inside a text field, you can use Power Query for doing this operation or calculations in DAX. In this video, I'll explain some functions in DAX that you can use to do this calculation. Most of these functions can be used inside a measure

value.title: Analyzing the performance of DISTINCTCOUNT in DAX
value.excerpt: Analyze the performance of a DAX measure based on a DISTINCTCOUNT calculation and evaluate possible optimizations. value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hrhEjg9yYvE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Optimizing DAX with cardinality estimation computing working days
value.excerpt: Learn how to estimate the cardinality of iterators computing the number of working days between two dates. Article and download: https://sql.bi/699689/?aff=yt  This is an important skill when optimizing DAX code.   How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: Sorting months in fiscal calendars in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows a basic technique used to sort months according to a fiscal calendar, by using a couple of calculated columns and the ‚Äúsort by column‚Äù feature of Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/492713?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0peKz7XjEdw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Understanding Performance Analyzer metrics in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer metrics imported in DAX Studio provide many details not available in Power BI Desktop. Learn the meaning of each number and how to use them to find report bottlenecks. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Understanding the difference between LASTDATE and MAX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains why in many cases, MAX should be used instead of LASTDATE to search for the last date in a time period using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/673766?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xZyJlgE1RsI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using CONCATENATEX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video showcases the use of CONCATENATEX, a handy DAX function to return a list of values in a measure. Article and download: https://sql.bi/206871
